intro: Ditassa rufinervia, commonly known as the red-veined dieback, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its unique botanical features. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
